description: Both you and Bob, retired engineers, volunteer at a busy community center that offers free woodworking workshops. Only one high-quality lathe is available, so an informal system has been in place for years: you and Bob alternate exclusive use of it during popular workshop days. Recently, increased attendance puts pressure on everyone to deliver engaging sessions. Before each week begins, you each decide—without consulting the other—whether to follow the alternating pattern, or try to book both days for yourself, hoping the other will keep to the agreement. If both respect the system, all goes smoothly. If one grabs both days, their workshops go exceptionally well, while the other must improvise. If both try to take both days, neither gets clear access, sessions are disrupted, and the sense of teamwork erodes.

When You chooses 'cooperate' and Bob chooses 'cooperate', You gets 3 and Bob gets 3.
When You chooses 'cooperate' and Bob chooses 'defect', You gets 0 and Bob gets 5.

When You chooses 'defect' and Bob chooses 'defect', You gets 1 and Bob gets 1.

scenario: Community Green Space Maintenance Challenge

behavior_choices.cooperate: volunteer significant effort for regular park maintenance
behavior_choices.defect: do minimal maintenance and avoid extra effort

You: cooperate , Bob: cooperate: Both you and Bob enjoy a well-kept park, the neighborhood's reputation grows, and future community projects are supported.
Your mutual effort creates a cycle of positive social capital and shared pride.
You: cooperate , Bob: defect: Bob benefits from the clean park without much effort and is seen as 'getting away with it'; you feel overburdened and question future volunteering.
Bob avoids work but still reaps the benefits, while you experience resentment and fatigue.
You: defect , Bob: cooperate: You avoid the work but still enjoy the well-kept park since Bob handles most maintenance.
Bob feels exploited, becomes less willing to volunteer next time.
You: defect , Bob: defect: The park's condition declines, events are canceled due to poor upkeep, and the neighborhood's image suffers.
Both you and Bob miss out on a pleasant space and community engagement dwindles.

description: You and Bob are new residents in a growing neighborhood and members of the local association. A once-popular community park needs regular volunteer maintenance to stay usable and attractive. Each month, you and Bob (along with other less active residents) quietly decide how much effort to personally put in. The quality of the park and the spirit of neighborhood cooperation depend on whether volunteers step up or leave the work to others. Your choices will influence not only the park’s state, but also ongoing trust and participation in future projects.
payoff_description:
When You chooses 'cooperate' and Bob chooses 'cooperate', You gets 3 and Bob gets 3.
When You chooses 'cooperate' and Bob chooses 'defect', You gets 0 and Bob gets 5.
When You chooses 'defect' and Bob chooses 'cooperate', You gets 5 and Bob gets 0.
When You chooses 'defect' and Bob chooses 'defect', You gets 1 and Bob gets 1.
